item.title: Sean add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sean add a quote by Jascha Heifetz
item.description: "No matter what side of the argument you are on, you always find people on your side that you wish were on the other." -- Jascha Heifetz

item.title: Sean add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The bigotry of the nonbeliever is for me nearly as funny as the bigotry of the believer." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sean add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "What matters most is not who is sitting in the White House, but "who is sitting in" -- and who is marching outside the White House, pushing for change." -- Howard Zinn

item.title: Sean add a quote by Edmund Wilson
item.description: "Marxism is the opium of the intellectuals" -- Edmund Wilson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The major problem&mdash;<i>one</i> of the major problems, for there are several&mdash;one of the many major problems with governing people is that of whom you get to do it; or rather of who manages to get people to let them do it to them. To summarize: it is a well-known fact that those people who must <i>want</i> to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it. To summarize the summary: anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sean add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sean add a quote by Noël Coward
item.description: "I don't know what London's coming to — the higher the buildings the lower the morals." -- Noël Coward

item.title: Sean add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Sean add a quote by Oscar Levant
item.description: "Underneath this flabby exterior is an enormous lack of character." -- Oscar Levant

item.title: Sean add a quote by Eduardo Galeano
item.description: "I don't believe in charity. I believe in solidarity. Charity is so vertical. It goes from the top to the bottom. Solidarity is horizontal. It respects the other person. I have a lot to learn from other people." -- Eduardo Galeano
